arts.ttl: 'Lapse of concentration cost us tonight': Reading boss on stoppage-time Burton defeat
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt was left frustrated with the officials and his side's game management on Tuesday night as his side lost 3-2 at Burton Albion. Trailing by two at the break, one which was offside, the visitors pulled the score all-square with two goals in as many minutes. However, a low cross on the counter in stoppage time earned relegation-threatened Burton a third successive win. On the result, Hunt said: "It is frustrating. The lad is two yards offside for the second goal- we hold the line well and have to rely on these officials to do their jobs properly because it’s costing us. We then have a stonewall penalty with Harvey on the wrong side of the defender not given and a free out given with a goalkeeper who has gone over himself and mistimed the jump.

arts.ttl: Burton Albion net in stoppage time to inflict third straight defeat on Reading
arts.sum: Reading suffered a third successive defeat, this time 3-2 at the hands of relegation threatened Burton Albion. Rumarn Burrell and Jon Dadi Bodvarsson had the hosts in a two-goal lead at half-time but a quickfire pair of strikes from Michael Craig and Harlee Dean looked to have earned the Royals a point. That was until the second minute of stoppage time when Burrell sealed his brace and earned a third win in a row for the East Midlands outfit. Looking for a reaction from the last two defeats, Reading and Burton played out an even opening exchange, with both sides mixing up the short and long play. Charlie Savage had the first effort, fizzing over the bar inside seven minutes after Chem Campbell’s cross.

arts.ttl: Rumarn Burrell snatches victory for Burton in five-goal thriller against Reading
arts.sum: Two goals in as many second-half minutes had hauled the Royals level.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Kelvin Ehibhatiomhan makes first start in three months at Burton
arts.sum: Reading forward Kelvin Ehibhatiomhan has returned from the start at Burton Albion, the only change from Saturday's defeat. The 21-year-old has made two cameos off the bench in recent weeks after suffering injury at Stockport County in October, but makes his first start in three months at the Pirelli Stadium. Noel Hunt's side have lost their last two matches and are now outside the top six, while Gary Bowyer's Brewers have won their last two. Former Reading striker Bodvarsson, who leads the line for the hosts, has scored three goals in the last two matches.

arts.ttl: Former Reading striker returns to League One on loan from Southampton
arts.sum: Former Reading striker Dominic Ballard has returned to League One, joining Cambridge United on loan until the end of the season. The 19-year-old spent time on loan with the Royals last season until a patella tendon injury saw him return to parent club, Southampton. Ending 2023/24 with five goals in 12 appearances, the teenager earned a move to Blackpool over the summer. Scoring once in 22 appearances under Steve Bruce at Bloomfield Road, Southampton recalled the youngster earlier this month.

arts.ttl: Reading 'reject' offer from League One rivals for out-of-contract defender
arts.sum: Reading have rejected an offer from League One rivals Stevenage for defender Michael Craig, according to reports. The 21-year-old arrived from Tottenham Hotspur in 2022 and has made 70 appearances for the first-team. Signed as a midfielder, the youngster has spent the last nine months at right-back, covering for club captain Andy Yiadom during a long-term injury. Playing 29 times this season, almost entirely at right-back, Craig is out of contract in the summer.

arts.ttl: Reading reject Stevenage bid for young midfielder
arts.sum: Reading have rejected a bid from fellow League One side Stevenage for Michael Craig, as per Pete O’Rourke.… The post Reading reject Stevenage bid for young midfielder appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Reading play-off race expected to fall off in latest Super Computer prediction
arts.sum: Reading are set for a slide down the table according to the latest SuperComputer predictions. The Royals, who lost 2-0 on Saturday at Leyton Orient, currently sit eighth after 26 matches with 12 wins. In the play-offs until last week, and still only one point outside the top six with a game in hand, many supporters and pundits have been linking the club with a strong finish in the top six. However, according to the Casino Hawks SuperComputer, Reading will drop into the bottom half and finish 13th. This would still represent a four position improvement on last year's 17th-place position, but may leave some disappointed with the prospect of just seven wins in the final 20 league matches.

arts.ttl: 'I can't praise him enough': Reading preparing to face in-form striker with Burton
arts.sum: Reading will have to keep former striker Jon-Dadi Bodvarsson quiet this evening as the Royals head up to relegation-threatened Burton Albion. The Royals, on a two-match losing streak, head to the Pirelli Stadium to face the Brewers, who sit 21st in the third tier. However, despite their lowly position, Gary Bowyer's side have won their last two fixtures and former striker Bodvarsson has netted three goals in that time. Arriving from Wrexham last week, the Iceland international had scored 17 goals in 56 appearances for the Royals between 2017 and 2019 before going on to play for Millwall and Bolton Wanderers.
